author: LeeHeffernan
text: A8:  I liked the idea mentioned on the blog of setting tentative publishing dates before the school year begins.  That could be very helpful for me because the end of the year always ends up being so crazy with finishing up projects.  #TWTBlog

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A6:  Our end of workshop share session is called Circle Check Out.  All authors share a line or an update on a project or a connection with the mini lesson concept.  They learn from each other every day that way.  #TWTBlog

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A6:  #TWTBlog  When not publishing with the press, authors in Room 200 work on DIY publishing, under their own press logos.  They're always working on publishing, like authors do.

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A6:  Our writing workshop is a small press.  We call it Popcorn Press.  All kids are authors here and I'm an editor.  #TWTBlog

author: LeeHeffernan
text: The editor stance is a great one too! :)  Respectful of the writer and also an advocate for their text  #TWTBlog https://t.co/HRXft2Yc3f

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A4:  We talk about publishing as a kind of symbiotic relationship.  Editor and author are doing different things during the conference, but they're both getting something out of the conference too.  #TWTBlog

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A3:  We do a lot of inquiry around publishing and small presses at the beginning of the year.  This is a publishing scavenger hunt that we have a good time with:  https://t.co/zUN8a5ny8S

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A3:  #TWTblog When kids are working together to find out how authors do things, it makes for a lively if long start to the workshop.  We use texts in the room to look for strong leads, or snapshots.

author: LeeHeffernan
text: A2:  We talk a lot about how editors and writers work together on publication work. #TWTBlog
